Posts.Title: Help me to decipher ultrasound results? phoenix33 VSM

Posts.Content: phoenix33 wrote: Hi guys, I had an ultrasound done recently for a lump I found in my left breast.  Got a copy of the report back today, and it says:  Ultrasound images demonstrate an elliptically shaped, lobulated, hypoechoic mass with internal acoustical densities approximating 2.6 cm x 1.6 cm x 5 mm. Summary:  Complex mass with blood flow approximating 2.6 cm x 1.6 cm corresponding with palpable mass in the 6 o'clock position in the left breast.  Can anyone explain what some of this means?  What makes a mass complex?  And is it bad that it has blood flow to it? Thanks. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Help me to decipher ultrasound results? phoenix33 VSM

Posts.Content: Sep 3, 2011 02:19PM phoenix33 wrote: Nlm - thanks for explaining all of that to me, I really appreciate it.  And thanks to everyone else also, I did take the suggestions and politely pushed, and guess what?  I found a great specialist and they were able to fit me in yesterday. I spent most of the afternoon getting mammos and ultrasounds, and talked to the doctor also who did say I would need a biopsy.  I have a core needle biopsy scheduled for next Thursday for that lump.  And they found some worrisome areas on my right breast (thickening tissue and a possible cyst) that they want to recheck in 6 months.  So now I just have to wait on the biopsy results, but I do feel so much better having some answers and being informed.
Posts.Title: Help me to decipher ultrasound results? phoenix33 VSM
